meanings.definition: To assign a task to someone.
meanings.sent1: I will attask you with organizing the files.
meanings.sent2: She always attasks me with watering the plants when she's away.
meanings.sent3: The boss decided to attask the office prankster with planning the next team-building activity.
meanings.sent4: The teacher attasked the students with creating a presentation on a famous scientist.
meanings.sent5: He attasked himself with the challenge of learning a new language in a month.

meanings.definition: A piece of work to be done or undertaken.
meanings.sent1: The attask of fixing the leaky faucet was finally completed.
meanings.sent2: She had a long list of attasks to finish before the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: Carrying out the attask of baking a cake for the party was more challenging than expected.
meanings.sent4: The attask of painting the entire house seemed never-ending.
meanings.sent5: Completing the attask of assembling the furniture required careful attention to detail.
